title: Calories in 1 Cup Mashed Potatoes
meta_description: Discover calories in 1 cup mashed potatoes, including carbs, protein, fat, full nutrition breakdown, and preparation tweaks for better tracking.
assumptions: Prepared with boiled russet potatoes, whole milk, butter, and salt; ~210 g per cup; no added cheese or gravy.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by potato type, milk/fat content, portion size, and cooking method. Check recipes or labels when available.

quick_answer.text: 1 cup of mashed potatoes provides ~237 kcal, mostly from carbs with some fat from butter.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Made without butter (use skim milk only)
Add 1 tbsp sour cream per cup
Use sweet potatoes instead of russet

faqs.q: How many calories in 1 cup mashed potatoes?
faqs.a: Approximately 237 kcal for a standard serving with milk and butter.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in 1 cup mashed potatoes?
faqs.a: About 35 g of carbs, including 3.2 g fiber and 3 g sugars.

faqs.q: Are mashed potatoes high in protein?
faqs.a: No, only ~4 g protein per cup; they're mostly carb-based.

faqs.q: How does preparation affect calories in mashed potatoes?
faqs.a: Adding more butter or cream increases calories; low-fat versions reduce them by 50-100 kcal per cup.

faqs.q: What's the sodium in 1 cup mashed potatoes?
faqs.a: ~600 mg, mainly from added salt; unsalted versions are lower.
